name: Use multi-chain(s)
description:
Allows to use the given multi-chain (registers it as a new executor) or a set of multi-chains.
It is a loading-time function. So, you should reload the current chain for changes to these settings to take effect.

controls.caption: Multi-chain JSON file(s)/folder(s)
controls.name: file
controls.description:
Path(s) to one or several multi-chain JSON file or folders, containing JSON files with specifications of multi-chains, separated by ";". In a case of folders, each folder is scanned recursively, and all multi-chain JSONs, found in the folder and its subfolders, become available to use.
Note: every path is trimmed, i.e. leading/trailing space characters, including line feeds, are removed. Thus, if you need several paths, separated by ";", you can place each path in a separate line.
You can use here relative paths (without starting "/" or "c:\"), for example, "test.dat" or "samples/test.dat". They will be resolved relative the current folder, containing the executed chain.
If this path starts with substring %TEMP%, %TEMP%/ or %TEMP%x. where x is OS-depended file separator character, this substring is replaced with the full path to the system temp directory (System.getProperty("java.io.tmpdir")) with ending file separator. For example, it is correct to write here %TEMP%my_file.dat, %TEMP%/my_file.dat or (in Windows) %TEMP%\my_file.dat.
Also you can use in this string Java system properties: "${name}", for example: "${java.io.tmpdir}", and executor system properties "${path.name.ext}", "${path.name}", "${file.name.ext}", "${file.name}", "${resources}" (chain path/file name with/without extension, resource folder of the platform, containing this function).

controls.caption: Requires existing file/folder
controls.name: fileExistenceRequired
controls.description: If set, and if some of file(s)/folder(s), specified in the previous parameter, do not exists, this function throws an exception. If cleared, this function just ignores all non-existing files or folders.

controls.caption: Strict mode
controls.name: strictMode
controls.description: If this flag is set, OR if the "strict" property in options/behavior section of the multi-chain specification is set, this function checks that all chain variants implementing the multi-chain are compatible with the interface specified in the multi-chain JSON file, for example, have all declared input/output ports with the same type. By default, this flag is cleared, but we recommend to set either this flag or the "strict" property.

controls.caption: Use also sub-chain(s)
controls.name: alsoSubChains
controls.description:
If set, also executes "Use sub-chain(s)" function with the same path(s) and default parameters. In other words, in this mode this function allows to use both multi-chain(s) and sub-chain(s), depending on the file content â€” is it multi-chain or sub-chain.
We recommend to use this flag only with a single or multiple FILES, but not with FOLDERS: in another case, sub-chains, probably located inside folders of multi-chains, will be loaded twice (here and while initializing multi-chains).
